item.title: Webhooks do's and dont's: what we learned after integrating +100 APIs
item.description:
Webhooks do's and dont's: what we learned after integrating +100 APIs

As modern applications are becoming more and more a composite of APIs and the serverless architectures are getting more attention, API providers can't afford any longer to expose only traditional REST endpoints. Traditional REST API are designed for when you want to allow a programmatical retrieve or post content, far from being optimal when you just want your application to be told when something changed.

item.title: When traveling, my iPad is essential and my Mac is the add-on
item.description:
When traveling, my iPad is essential and my Mac is the add-on

For the past year I've been traveling with a 12.9-inch iPad Pro and leaving my MacBook Air home whenever possible. Traveling with only an iPad can feel freeing and it can also feel confining, depending on what you need to accomplish.

item.title: Collaboration: Website editing, together
item.description:

Great things are rarely made in isolation. Only when we team up with others we can truly make our work shine. item.title: How To Reject The Belief On The Silver Bullet
item.description:
How To Reject The Belief On The Silver Bullet

As developers, we tend to believe there is a perfect solution for every problem and that can drive us to make wrong conclusions In psychology there is a concept called Absolute Thinking. It represents a common tendency to think in "black and white" terms. It happens when someone provides two alternatives to a problem that doesn't have just two alternatives.
